Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui

Class AbstractPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui.AbstractPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Page, java.io.Serializable
    public abstract class AbstractPage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Page

    An AbstractPage is a convenience class to make the implementation of pages easier. It provides service methods to control the application flow or manipulate actions.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Page, Serialized Form

      • createContent

        public final void createContent​(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                                UI ui)
        Description copied from interface: Page

        Will be called by the Tabris UI during the instantiation of a Page. Within this method the UI code should be created.

        Specified by:
        createContent in interface Page
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent to use for creating SWT widgets.
        ui - the ui to control the application flow and share data.

      • createContent

        public abstract void createContent​(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                                   PageData data)

        Will be called by the Tabris UI during the instantiation of a Page. Within this method the UI code should be created.

        Parameters:
        parent - the parent to use for creating SWT widgets.
        data - the PageData object for the newly created page.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Closes the current page.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when it's called on a top level page.

      • openPage

        public void openPage​(java.lang.String pageId)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Opens a new page with the defined id.

        Parameters:
        pageId - the id of the page to open. Must not be null or empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no page exist for the given id.

      • openPage

        public void openPage​(java.lang.String pageId,
                     PageData data)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Opens a new page with the defined id and passes PageData to the new page.

        Parameters:
        pageId - the id of the page to open. Must not be null or empty.
        data - the data for the new page. Can be accessed using getData() on the new page.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no page exist for the given id.

      • setActionVisible

        public void setActionVisible​(java.lang.String actionId,
                             boolean visible)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Manipulates the visibility of an Action.

        Parameters:
        actionId - the id of the action to manipulate. Must not be null or empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Action for the given id exist.

      • setActionEnabled

        public void setActionEnabled​(java.lang.String actionId,
                             boolean enabled)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Manipulates the enable state of an Action.

        Parameters:
        actionId - the id of the action to manipulate. Must not be null or empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no Action for the given id exist.

      • getUIConfiguration

        public UIConfiguration getUIConfiguration()

        Returns the UIConfiguration used to configure the current UI. The configuration returned has session scope and can be used to manipulate the UI during runtime e.g. adding PageConfigurations and ActionConfigurations.

        Since:
        1.2
